summary:
I am a data scientist with a background in molecular biology. With my analytical skills and creativity, I create value from data. 
Having worked in three different countries in Europe, I am a flexible professional who enjoys new experiences. My greatest strengths are perseverance, analytical thinking, and my eagerness to learn.

awards.title: Best Poster Prize
awards.description: I received 333 US Dollar from the RNA Society for my scientific poster at a conference in Stockholm.

awards.title: Biomolecular Science Mobility Award
awards.description: I received 2000 Euro for my research training in Bern, Switzerland.

awards.title: Top scores for Mathematics
awards.description:
I got the highest score of my secondary school on my final exam in mathematics. 
My grades were: 
9.7 / 10 for Mathematics A (without even taking the lessons)
9.3 / 10 for Mathematics B

certifications.name: Developing Big Data Solutions with Azure Machine Learning
Data Science Research Methods: Python Edition
Principles of Machine Learning: Python Edition
Essential Math for Machine Learning: Python Edition
Introduction to Python for Data Science
Analyzing and Visualizing Data with Microsoft Power BI
Ethics and Law in Data and Analytics

projects.title: Purchase orders, stock levels and sales orders
projects.description: Predicting the deliveries of purchase orders and sales orders, and the stock levels in the company's warehouses. This project is for and in cooperation with a big international company.

projects.title: Pain levels
projects.description: Predicting pain levels in patients, so pain medication could be started earlier, which would result in lower doses of the medication and fewer side effects.

projects.title: Delivery times
projects.description: For a transportation company, we predicted whether packages will arrive in time. By this, customers can now be informed of delays in advance.

projects.title: Waiting times
projects.description: For the emergency room of a hospital, we predicted the waiting times. The waiting time is now shown on a screen in the waiting rooms and updated every 5 minutes based on real-time data.

projects.title: Cash registers
projects.description: For the Johan Cruiff ArenA, we looked at cash register efficiency and made suggestions for improvement. This project was done with a group of 6 Techionista's and involved big data analysis and data mining.

projects.title: Evictions
projects.description: In this project, I analysed big data and applied a Machine Learning Regression model to predict the number of evictions. Independent test data showed my model to have a predictive accuracy of 80%.

publications.name: Unstructured 5'-tails act through ribosome standby to override inhibitory structure at ribosome binding sites
Cell sorting and next-generation sequencing reveals  sequence preferences of ribosome standby sites
Two antisense RNAs target the transcriptional regulator CsgD to inhibit curli synthesis
Characterization of a Giardia lamblia WB C6 clone resistant to the isoflavone formononetin.
Characterization of Giardia lamblia WB C6 clones resistant to nitazoxanide and to metronidazole.

profile_positions.description:
I followed the Microsoft Azure Academy for Data Science, powered by Techionista. 
The program includes, among others: 
* Visualizing data with Power BI 
* Querying data with Transact-SQL 
* Python
* Azure Machine Learning
profile_positions.title: Data Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Taking time off to: 
- Move from Sweden to the Netherlands and into my new home. 
- Spend a lot of quality time with my children. 
- Orient myself on the next step in my career, finding out I want to continue in Data Science.
profile_positions.title: Sabbatical

company.name: Uppsala University, Department of Cell and Molecular Biology

profile_positions.description: In the Institute of Cell and Molecular Biology of Uppsala University in Sweden, I performed fundamental research on the mechanisms of protein translation in bacteria. I showed that certain RNA sequences can act as so-called ribosome standby sites, thus allowing high translation rates. My major findings served as a proof-of-principle of the ribosome standby model, and were published in "Nucleic Acid Research" (impact factor 11).
profile_positions.title: PhD Researcher

profile_positions.description: I have been teaching Microbiology to Biology Students and Engineers of various levels, from first year Bachelor students to Master students. I have experience in teaching very small groups of students and big groups up to 100 students, both during practicals and seminars/workshops. The evaluations of my teaching skills by both students and fellow teachers have been extremely positive throughout the years.
profile_positions.title: Teacher

profile_positions.description:
My research consisted of: 
Establishment and applications of an in vitro cocultivation system for the parasite Giardia lamblia with human intestinal cells 
The effects of several drugs on growth and protein expression of Giardia lamblia 

Part of my work has been published in peer-reviewed scientific journals.
profile_positions.title: Researcher | Institute of Parasitology

profile_positions.description: Research on the functions of and interactions between two protein families (P4 ATPases and the Cdc50 protein family), which are involved in phospholipid translocation across the membrane in yeast.
profile_positions.title: Research training | Membrane Enzymology

profile_positions.description: Teaching of mathematics to biology students.
profile_positions.title: Teaching Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: Training and coaching of basketball to children, teenagers and adults.

Within a project by "Wethouder Hans Spekman" - in which the goal was to promote various sports to financially disadvantaged children - I gave a series of Basketball lessons to kids grade 5-6 in one of the city's poorer areas.
